critique: The document is an official amendment to the Code of Fair Competition for the Automobile Manufacturing Industry. The tone is formal and bureaucratic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of stability and confidence in the government's ability to manage the economy during the emergency. There is a slight sense of hope that the emergency will end soon, but also a pragmatic extension of the expiration date. Joy: 3 (slight hope for the end of the emergency), Sadness: 2 (acknowledgment of the ongoing emergency), Anger: 1 (no indication of anger), Fear: 2 (acknowledgment of the ongoing emergency), Disgust: 1 (no indication of disgust), Surprise: 1 (no indication of surprise). Revised scores: Joy: 3, Sadness: 2, Anger: 1, Fear: 2, Disgust: 1, Surprise: 1
